name: hnrss
tagline: Custom, realtime RSS feeds for Hacker News
body:
# Hacker News RSS feeds

hnrss provides custom, realtime RSS feeds for Hacker News.

## Feeds

The following feeds are available:

- **Firehose** — Every new [post](http://hnrss.org/newest) and [comment](http://hnrss.org/newcomments) as it arrives
- **Points** — [Posts](http://hnrss.org/newest?points=300) with more than N points
- **Activity** — [Posts](http://hnrss.org/newest?comments=250) with more than N comments
- **Self-posts** — All "[Ask HN](http://hnrss.org/ask)" and "[Show HN](http://hnrss.org/show)" posts, along with [polls](http://hnrss.org/polls)
- **Users** — New [posts](http://hnrss.org/submitted?id=tokenadult) and [comments](http://hnrss.org/threads?id=tptacek) made by a given user
- **Threads** — Each new comment made [in a given thread](http://hnrss.org/item?id=7864813)
- **Searches** — New [posts](http://hnrss.org/newest?q=git) and [comments](http://hnrss.org/newcomments?q=django) matching a given search term

### Firehose

The "firehose" feeds contains all new [posts](http://hnrss.org/newest) and [comments](http://hnrss.org/newcomments) as they appear on Hacker News.

### Points

Maybe you like the idea of the firehose, but want to slow it down just a *bit.* You can do that with the `?points=N` filter. With this filter added on to a firehose feed, only posts with more than N points will be shown.

So, for example, here's a feed of [posts with 200+ points](http://hnrss.org/newest?points=200).

**Note:** The `?points=N` filter doesn't work with `/newcomments`. This is [by design](https://github.com/algolia/hn-search/issues/55#issuecomment-73599729).

### Activity

Similar to the points filter, you can also filter posts based the number of comments it has.

For example, here's an RSS feed with [all posts containing 25+ comments](http://hnrss.org/newest?comments=25).

### Self-posts

If you're looking for RSS feeds for [Ask HN](http://hnrss.org/ask), [Show HN](http://hnrss.org/show), or [polls](http://hnrss.org/polls), we've got you covered.

### Users

If you don't want to miss a post or comment by a given user, you can subscribe to that user's RSS feed.

The URLs for both posts and comments, just posts, and just comments are (respectively):

- http://hnrss.org/user?id=USERNAME
- http://hnrss.org/submitted?id=USERNAME
- http://hnrss.org/threads?id=USERNAME

With `USERNAME` replaced with the username in question.

As a shortcut, when on a user's [profile page](https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=tptacek) you can replace "https://news.ycombinator.com" with "http://hnrss.org". This also works on a user's [submitted](https://news.ycombinator.com/submitted?id=tptacek) and [comments](https://news.ycombinator.com/threads?id=tptacek) pages.

### Threads

If there's some thread you're particularly interested in, you can subscribe its RSS containing new comments in that thread at http://hnrss.org/item?id=THREAD_ID.

`THREAD_ID` is the number after `?id=` when viewing a post's comments page ([Example](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=7895504)). Or, as a shortcut, replace "https://news.ycombinator.com" with "http://hnrss.org" when on a comments page to get the RSS feed.

### Searches

You can also filter based on search terms via the `?q=SEARCH_TERM` query filter.

For example, here's a feed of all [new posts that mention "Django"](http://hnrss.org/newest?q=Django) and all [new comments that mention "git"](http://hnrss.org/newcomments?q=git).

By default, searches only look at post titles. This is probably what you'll want 95% of the time, but this behavior can be customized via the `search_attrs` filter. Here's a few examples:

- http://hnrss.org/newest?q=Wordpress — Search for articles with 'Wordpress' in the post title only.
- http://hnrss.org/newest?q=Wordpress&search_attrs=url — Search for articles with 'Wordpress' in the post URL only.
- http://hnrss.org/newest?q=Wordpress&search_attrs=title,url — Search for articles with 'Wordpress' in the post title or URL.
- http://hnrss.org/newest?q=Wordpress&search_attrs=default — Don't restrict search attributes at all. This searches for articles containing 'Wordpress' in all attributes indexed by Algolia. This was the behavior of searches prior to June 3, 2015.

### Misc.

By default, the RSS `<link>` element points to the submitted article's URL. The `<link>` element can be changed to point to the Hacker News comment page by appending `?link=comments` to the end of the URL. See [here](http://hnrss.org/newest?link=comments) for an example.

The RSS `<description>` element contains a link to the comment page when `<link>` points the article (i.e., the default) and a link to the article when `<link>` points to the comment page (e.g., with `?link=comments`). This way you can easily get to either page.

You can disable the `<description>` element entirely by passing `?description=0` to a [URL](http://hnrss.org/newest?description=0).

You can combine multiple filters with the ampersand character ('&'). For example, here's the URL for all posts with "git" in the title and that have more than 25 points: http://hnrss.org/newest?q=git&search_attrs=title&points=25.

## Credits

hnrss is powered by [Algolia](https://hn.algolia.com/api), the
[official Hacker News API provider](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=7547578).
